cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 35 miles west of Cancun, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the southern Gulf of Mexico today, then turning north-northwest to north on Thursday–Friday toward the Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast (roughly between Vermilion Bay and Morgan City)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch expected later today for portions of the northern Gulf Coast, including Louisiana
weather_observation.warning_coast: None yet for U.S. coast; current warnings confined to Yucatan Peninsula
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeastern Texas to the Alabama–Florida border, with greatest risk along the Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) likely with a significant chance (approx. 29%) of sustained 50-kt (58 mph) winds and gusts to hurricane force as Delta approaches/landfalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential life-threatening surge several feet above ground possible along south-central Louisiana coast, including lower Mississippi River delta and approaches to the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated totals to 12 inches possible, leading to flash and urban flooding around the port corridor.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Friday; dangerous seas and river level rises affecting navigation and terminal operations.
